description: The assistant parses a trial’s exclusion clause about recent interventional study participation, converts the free‑text criteria into a structured JSON schema, queries the EMR for eligible breast‑cancer patients, sends them secure portal invitations, and records a patient’s consent response.

messages.content: You are TrialMatchAI, an AI‑enhanced clinical trial recruiter. Use the provided tools to parse eligibility criteria, search the EMR for matching patients, communicate securely via patient portals, and record consent decisions. Maintain an audit trail of all actions.

We are launching a Phase III trial for metastatic breast cancer. The key eligibility criteria are:

Inclusion:
- Age 18‑75
- Histologically confirmed metastatic breast cancer
- ECOG performance status ≤ 1
- Prior treatment with at least one line of endocrine therapy

Exclusion:
- Any other active malignancy
- Uncontrolled heart disease
- Participation in any interventional clinical trial within the past 30 days

Please find eligible patients and contact them.
First, I will transform the free‑text inclusion and exclusion criteria into a machine‑readable JSON schema.

messages.content: The criteria have been parsed. I will now search the EMR for patients who meet the inclusion criteria and do **not** meet any of the exclusion conditions.
I found three patients who satisfy the criteria. I will send each a secure portal message inviting them to learn more about the study.

arguments.subject: Invitation to Participate in a Phase III Breast Cancer Trial
arguments.body:
## Dear Patient,

You have been identified as potentially eligible for a new Phase III clinical trial investigating a novel therapy for metastatic breast cancer. 

**Key Details**:
- Trial Phase: III
- Estimated Duration: 12 months
- No additional cost to you

If you are interested or would like more information, please reply to this message or click the consent link below.

[Consent Form](https://secureportal.example.com/consent/PAT001)

Thank you for considering participation.
